div1.p: Kean requests a copy of the orders forbidding private use of government vehicles.

div1.head: Official Request from Jefferson Randolph Kean to F.H. Beach, February 18, 1902
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF SUPT.
DEPARTMENT OF CHARITIES
HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Havana, Cuba. February 18th, 1902.
To the Adjutant,
Columbia Barracks,
Quemados, Cuba.
(Thro' the Adjutant General of the Department)
Sir:--
div1.p:
I have the honor to request to be furnished with a
copy of the orders or instructions which, as I have been informed,
have recently been issued by the Post Commander to drivers
of Government vehicles, to exclude officers on staff duty and
members of their families from riding in said vehicles.

closer.signed:
J.R. Kean.
Major & Surgeon U.S.A.
Superintendent, Dept. of Charities.
